meanings.sent1: The buckramed collar felt rigid against his neck.
meanings.sent2: Her buckramed dress rustled as she walked.
meanings.sent3: The buckramed hat made him look like a walking statue.
meanings.sent4: The buckramed walls of the old castle seemed to whisper ancient tales.
meanings.sent5: The buckramed flag fluttered proudly in the wind.

meanings.sent1: She buckramed the fabric to give it structure.
meanings.sent2: He buckramed the costume to make it more durable.
meanings.sent3: The tailor buckramed the edges to prevent fraying.
meanings.sent4: The artist buckramed the canvas before painting.
meanings.sent5: They buckramed the sails to withstand the strong winds.
